review: Slow slow slow. Waited 30 minutes for appetizers and another 15 minutes for our check.  We had to ask 2 times for our check, he came by once to say he's printing it then forgot until we asked again.  Unbelievable.  Now I remember why we don't go there and won't be going again.

Update. We got food poisoning. DO NOT EAT HERE!  You can go to any Chili's. Go to Waikele or Aiea. I know Chili's is one of the few restaurants in Mililani but food poisoning and bad service is unacceptable.

This is one of my favorites.  I prefer sitting in the bar side,  the service is better there and more relaxing for me.  I always leave satisfied and any problems are always made right.  I love the portions and price.  I never leave hungry.   The new sliders are great with the Triple Dipper.

Growing up down the street from a Chili's has probably contributed greatly to my obesity. GREATLY. But did that stop me from going? Hell no, Chili's is freaking delicious! I have ordered everything on their menu. Even the "local" plate. And all of it is tasty. It better be tasty, it all has 1000+ calories in it.  Over the years, it's gotten expensive. I remember the days when the Paradise Pie and Molten Chocolate Lava Cake were only $5.99. Now they're easily $10 each. I have had bad service and great service at this place. And normally when I point out an error in service, the server is quick to fix, comp, or discount. The most common mistake I encounter at this restaurant (unless they are purposely doing it) is putting applewood bacon on my burger that should have smokehouse bacon. I may sound petty, but there is a BIG difference in the price of the burger depending on which bacon you order. Personal Favorites to drown my fatness in...don't get me wrong, I am normally accompanied by fellow fatties who like to stuff themselves to the brims with fat too ^_^: - Queso & unlimited salsa/chips or Appetizer Trio to share - Honey Chipotle Chicken Crispers, can substitute side fries with any side - Unlimited soup & salad...which I order to try and fool myself that I am eating "healthier", but the dressing-drenched cesear and chicken enchilada soup are actually just as calorie-laden as a stick of butter. If your server is cool, they'll let you interchange salads and soups for tasting fun! - Cajun ribeye, covered in garlic butter, of course - Jalapeno Smokehouse Bacon Burger - Everything else.  *And NO it's not mexican food! Or even Tex-Mex food. Chili's is the perfect example of what Amerrrrrrrica does to mexican food. And then they stuff it with more cheese. I have noticed that people are complaining about crowds and slow service.  Chili's FATTY PRO TIP: Chili's implemented a "call ahead policy" years ago and I am surprised that not many people take advantage of it. If you frequent the restaurant the number is RIGHT THERE on the hostess stand. It is handy and useful! Especially if I am trying to go on a Saturday night at 8pm. Call them up and put your name on the waitlist before you get there. And then people get mad when you get seated before them even though they've been sitting in the foyer for 30min.  And when there are times that the wait is an hour more, I just call the Waikele Chili's, which is only 5 miles away, to check their waittime. And very rarely, if both are crowded, I'll call the Pearlridge Chili's which is only another 5 miles away.

My favorite Chili's location on the island. Waikele has let me down several times lately and finally... no more! I will only go to the Mililani location, and each time I've visited, it has been great! Located in the Mililani Town Center in between Taco Bell and O'Reilly Auto Parts. There is parking in a private lot off to the side as well as in front. If you go for dinner, it could be very busy. We went during lunch and there was a ton of parking available.  I've been craaaaaaving a burger. I know there are many joints on the island that people will swear has THE BEST burger, but I find that Chili's has THE BEST burger I've eaten! YES, Chili's!!! So on Mother's Day, the BF took me to Chili's for lunch since I had my burger craving... Upon entering, there were 2 hostesses and a host at the podium. They all warmly greeted us, and I was given a pink long stemmed flower and a "Happy Mother's Day"... awww how sweet!!! (hey, I am a Mom! To 3 babies! 3 four-legged babies!) We were shown to our booth and our server greeted us literally less than a minute later. Her name was Rainynoell. She was very friendly and efficient... and full of smiles! We started off with the triple dipper. The BF likes the southwest egg rolls, I LOVE the chicken crispers, and we share the bone in buffalo wings. The appetizer arrived fairly quickly and the items were hot and fresh. Ohhh how I LOVE LOVE LOVE the chicken crispers at Chili's!! For our main meals, the BF ordered the southerwestern BBQ big mouth burger with fries. It comes with cheddar cheese, onion strings, thick cut smoked applewood bacon, and he added the avocado. BBQ sauce is on the side. The burger was cooked to a perfect medium and it was JUICY!!! I got my FAVE. Mushroom swiss burger... adding on bacon and avocado with fries. The burger was HUUUUUUMANGOUS!!! It was cooked to a PERFECT medium and it was SOOOOO JUICY. There were SO many strips of bacon and a GENEROUS portion of yummy sauteed mushrooms. I was in heeeaavveeenn!!!  For dessert, we ordered the oreo molten cake, but to go since we were SO full! It's very sweet but VERY delicous, a must try for any Oreo lover (sorry, too hungry and forgot to take the picture at home!) Other servers came by to fill our strawberry lemonade (although only half empty)... YAY for teamwork!... as did a male manager... impressive! A female manager stopped by to see how our lunch went and gave us a $10 off coupon for our next visit, and she wished me a Happy Mother's Day as well.  All in all, EXCEPTIONAL service (from everyone), OMG YUMMY DELICIOUS HOT MADE TO ORDER FOOD (oink oink!), and an AWESOME experience for my Mother's Day lunch!! 5 stars!!!... and I will be back for more crispers and that burger!!!

I do not like chili's period. With that said, here we go! First of all, the wait for a table is crazy. Once you get a table, it takes another century to get your order in. After that you wait even longer to get your food. I prefer to just have drinks here and maybe chips n dip. I have been to this location about 3 times (never my choice) and every single time it was the samething...wait wait wait and wait. Do not come here if you are in a rush or are already hungry.

Want to go some place simple for Fathers Day with the family (everyone loves Chili's). Wanted to try this spot, cause if there was a long wait...we're gonna go to Ruby T. But they said approx 20 min wait, but to our amazement...the table ws ready in less than 5 mins. That's always nice way to start with a quick sit down. The waitress was on top of things...drinks, apps, entrees and the refills. Also, the manager stopped by to ask for refills and then gave a $10 coupon (Fathers Day) for a future visit at any Chili's. Although the Pearl Ridge location is closer, I'll be returning to this spot on Mililani. Ample parking, friendly staff and the food (shrimp tacos w/rice&beans and broccoli) was just right (perfect). Awesome job the to staff tonight...holidays are always tough but they were on point!!

For as long as Chili's has been open, this is my first time here. My brother and sister-in-law was in town and we decided to go to dinner before they left. I was pleasantly surprise, the service was really good and the waiter was really cool to my nephew. We had a table of 20 and surprisingly the food was quick, and on a Saturday. I had that three appetizer plate and was good....I was full after that. When the salmon and Cajun chicken came, I got my second wind and polished that thing off. The food is the same throughout the establishment so I knew that I would like it, I like the places that emphasize the customer service experience and I will definitely return.
Usually have pretty bad service, and the food is just OK. The only great thing is the strawberry lemonade.
Happy hour was a bargain.  Enjoyed the platter with loaded baked potatoe soup.  We intended to jus that've pupus and dessert.  Too much food, we were too full to enjoy dessert.  Next time.
Poor service and the food takes forever to be served. Don't waste your time here or money. We've stayed away from this Chilis to see if time would perhaps fix their issues. Not enough time I guess.

The to-go service here has been GREAT all three times we've used it. The servers who work that side are so friendly and helpful. Last time, I actually tried calling Ruby Tuesday first because I had gift cards to use up, but they put me on hold for 5 minutes and no one ever picked up to take my order so I called Chili's - great decision! They picked up and took my order immediately. I got there a couple minutes early, and David was so friendly, he offered me a glass of water while I waited (do you want ice? Lemon? - seriously, he made my day). He even offered me a tip - if all you want is a cheeseburger, order a burger with cheese, otherwise you order a bacon cheeseburger without the bacon and it costs $0.80 more. Food is always good, I will keep going back because the staff is so friendly!

the only reason i come back cuz the food is pretty decent...not to mention love the chips and salsa....most ppl enjoy the food! on the other hand there r areas that need improvement! most of the staff r'nt always friendly.....and the wait time to order ur food kinda takes awhile...then getting ur food is a long wait...and if u go in with a large party, chances r they may forget to bring out someone's food... in comparison to when they first opened to now....all i can say is yikes!!!  not to mention a couple of times a small roach joined us for dinner at the table.   i give 4 stars for the food...2 stars r for the areas that need improvement! (and this is for all chilis...not jus the one in mililani)

Went here for a work lunch at 1100 this week.  When I walked in, no one came out to greet me for 5-10 minutes. (For background, the place was dead quiet.  A handful of diners already eating, and that's it.) Three chunky female servers were just gossiping away to my right -- even staring at me -- and not one came over to address the only customer at the podium. I'll stress that again: THEY WERE GAGGLED AROUND DOING NOTHING BUT TALKING, MADE EYE CONTACT WITH ME, AND THEN BLATANTLY IGNORED ME.  When a host finally came out, he didn't even address the obvious wait, much less apologize for it.  Customer service = garbage.  If I'm gonna pay to eat at your place, then you should really consider hiring people who care to serve people: just a thought. I'd've been happier holding this lunch at a local truck.  Even the food was (AT BEST) all right. Again: local food from a smaller restaurant  would've been comparable in price, but galactically better in quality.  AND IT WOULD'VE BEEN FASTER.  The pace here was GLACIAL with the food.  Considering how sleepy the restaurant was ... what's the issue? Only saving grace was the bartender (a girl named "Sheera".). Mixes a fantastic drink, but ... I'm not at this joint for the drinks, unfortunately. CONS: -- Rude, incompetent wait staff -- Mediocre food for Oahu prices -- VERY slow in showing up with food (even when the restaurant's nearly empty) PRO: -- The "Princess of Power" working the bar.  Love you, sweetheart!  Please consider a better venue to showcase your under-appreciated skillset! Will not come here again. What a blight.

I enjoy going Chili's Grill and Bar.  It's one of those places where it feels like it's a Friday at the end of a crazy work week.  It's always busy here.  No matter what time of day or what day of the week.  This place always seems pretty packed.  It's crazy.   I like coming here with friends or my husband or even my husband and my inlaws.  It definitely is a noisy environment, which I have to be in the mood for.  The outside area looks pretty nice, but we've never dined outside.  Come to think of it...I don't think I've ever seen anyone eating out there when we've gone.  It does look nice, though. I always get the steak fajitas.  They're pretty good, actually.  I've eaten fajitas at Mexican places and didn't think they were as good as Chili's.  I guess I just love the veggies it comes with.  When I'm not that hungry, I order that grilled lime shrimp.  Apparently, I can just order that as a side and then add veggies like broccoli.  Inexpensive meal right there.  I try to save room for dessert, because I just love the Chocolate Molten Cake.  So sinful.  I love it! Glad Mililani has a Chili's!

Consistenty great food for the value.  Usually get great service, except for the occasional slow server. I usually just order the triple play or whatever it is called.The seating by the bar is usually available and the several tvs show a variety of sports channels.  A good go to for pau hana get together with friends
1st family dinner since hubby has returned and Chili's made it special!

I wouldn't eat here again. Me and my bf went and the service was horrible she didn't check on us once, didn't refill our drinks! Told me that the blender was broken and right when she walked away I heard the stupid blender going :( my desert came before my dinner! By now I'm SUPER mad! We then waited like 20 mins for our food to come FINALLY some other server comes and tell us that our waitress went home and he's our server. She didn't even bother to at least tell us she was going home! Ughhhhh!!  I love chilis but I would NEVER go to this one because of that waitress I wish I remembered her name!

Happy Hour here is pretty Stellar! Chili's is a great place to go mid afternoon to unwind after class or a long day at work.  They have good beer specials, pupu specials, and their entrees are large enough to share.  Not to mention, they have complimentary chips and salsa, woot woot!  I love coming here to catch a game and snack!   Quick Tip:  $5 off bill of $20 or more with your IDcard discount :)

While the food was decent to good and the staff was friendly, it took FOREVER to get our order taken and even longer to have our food delivered. This is my second try at this location with the same results. I won't be back.

We had a three choice appetizer which included egg rolls, mini burgers and buffalo wings(bone in) it came with three dipping sauces ....man it was darn good.... My better half ordered the toasted turkey sandwich and fries, I had a few bites and I must say everything on that plate was pretty darn good...... For dessert we had the chocolate chip paradise pie which comes to your table still warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream , topped with hot fudge and caramel the pie itself is a chewy bar of chocolate chips, walnuts and coconut ,had a few bites of that too.....real good. Service was great.....the restaurant was real laid back, not to fancy but just enough..only thing I found kind of a pain was the hanging light fixtures which I felt was a little bit too low it was right above my forehead.. But other than that I really enjoyed it and will be going there again.. Oh yeah almost forgot ....the beer was awesome

Ok I have to just come out: I aM a chilis expert. I've kept it a secret but everyone has a guilty pleasure right? Well chils is mine. That said, this one is the best on the island. And I've been to em all. Alone.
Very crappy food over cooked tasted awful and for 100$ expected more and still waiting for my dessert WTH never again

We went to Chili's for a work lunch today. The lunch combos for $10.99 and $11.99 are a pretty good deal. There are sure to be enough choices for everyone. The chicken enchilada soup is great, albeit a little on the salty side. The chicken Fajitas is a great deal considering the lunch combo size still comes with 3 tortillas and a full bonless chicken breast. Chips and salsa is always a good starter too. If you still have room after all of that the Hot Molten Cake is to die for.

The place was clean and the hostess was very nice. That's about the only good things I noticed about this place... We sat in the last booth in the bar closest to the kitchen. This is probably the loudest seat in the whole place. Waiters tended to hang around the bartender and talk (loud) and from this seat I could hear a lot of the workers laughing and messing around in the kitchen (and dropping things.) Perhaps if they bothered the chefs less and worked, the food would get on the tables to the customers faster.  We waited a very long time for our food. So long that my daughter said "Mommy let's just go home." The food arrived and although it was nice and hot, everything was GREASY. The tortilla chips and chicken tenders that came with our Triple Dipper Appetizer were so oily that our fingers were shiny with oil after eating. Then came our fajita trio, the rice was also shiny with oil. The worse part about our experience was our waitress who just seemed like she was unhappy to be there. When she dropped off our drinks she responded to my "thank you very much" with a "hmmm". Same thing when I asked for more napkins and when my husband's soda was refilled. Most places I go to say "you're welcome." The only time she checked on us was at the end of the meal to see if we wanted dessert. I told her just a take out box and the check would be fine. She dropped off the take out box and check and I never saw her again. We waited and waited for her to come and pick up our check. By then the dinner had dragged on way too long so my husband and daughter went to the car to wait. Finally another server noticed me waiting and rang up my check. I wish this guy was my server, at least he smiled and told me "Thank you for joining us." I got another nice "Thank you" from the hostess as I walked out the door...never to return.

i have vowed to boycott this joint again! After a few months of regretful visits,last night made me officially want to hex this place and their crappy hostess and server!   We step in and the blonde hostess with the glasses gave us a look as if we stepped in dog poo and was stinking up her restaurant (which i assure you we did not! and i was very nice when asking for a seat for 2)..whatever. She sits us in a booth and puts the menus on the table and walks away. 1st person on my crap list. We wait for about 5mins till this scruffy guy comes almost dragging his body to our table to ask for our drink order. No "hi, my name is __" No "did you guys hear about the specials?". This guy was lame! we ordered drinks and even hunted him down to order our triple dipper and entree. A family of 5 ends up sitting next to us and this fool actually does a 180 and kindly greets them with his name, specials, drink list etc. i was pretty pissed. Just bc we were younger and there was only 2 of us, how dare he act so shitty to us and professional to another table. We never got refills (almost $7 for a iced tea and pepsi) they forgot to bring the chips with our dip, the entree came out litterally 5mins after we got the appettizer. Piss. Me .Off. The few other times we've come we loved the servers, but after last night we'll pass for another few months. Upside was, they participate with the ID card so you get $5 off $25. I used to serve before and i know the importance of tipping but this dbag got $3 from me on a $45 tab.

They have a massive food selections on their menu which is amazing! And we had a very pleasant lunch experience, our food was delicious and beautifully plated! The restaurant was nice and clean, our waitress was incredibly friendly to us. Everybody was satisfied and left with a stuffed belly! We will definitely go back again in the future.

Slow service, typical food and several incorrect orders. Ordered mashed potatoes and recieved rice and also ordered a side salad that never came. Waitress was very friendly though, which is why it recieved two stars instead of one.

After swearing off the place, we decided to surprise our kids and take them there for a 4th of July lunch.  My husband and I were hesitant but we were greeted right way with a hearty "Aloha" from Camile Velasco.  My husband and I had watched that season of American Idol but don't consider ourselves fans of the show or the singers.  I bring it up just to say that she never brought it up and was very professional.  We brought it up to her and asked her to take a pic with our daughter but other than that, she was very cool about everything.  She was on it in regards to getting out orders in fast and checking up on us to make sure everything was going good.  She made a lot of recommendations that we didn't try yesterday but probably will in the future.  The service was so great, we're willing to go back there again but definitely only for lunch.  I did like the new lunch combo that they have, soup with your sandwich of choice and fries.  As usually, I love their chips & salsa and artichoke dip.  We were too full to have our molten cake but since the lunch service is great we'll go back for desserts.

What does one desire to fill their tummy-tums after a long hard day at work but yet stuffed to their eyeballs in Thai food on the daily??? Why, Chili's just may be the choice...especially if you live in Mililani Town. (why is it that there just never seems to be anything good to eat in Mililani??) So, the mini-me's and the favorite foodie friend decided that we would hit up Chili's to get some grub. OK! Why not?? First off, let me start by saying that it really sucks when you crave some nasty moz sticks and they no longer have them on the menu. :(  Oh well...Grilled Shrimp Tacos were much too filling anyways with the avocado and super spicy sauce. I pass on the Uncle Ben's style rice just because it tastes gross (blechhhhh). The kiddos split a full rack of ribs and they all seemed to love it. What kind of trip to Chili's would it be if we didnt save room for the Chocolate Lava Cake??? yes, I'll have one please!! I wanted it all to myself but I did eventually share with the fam. Sharing is caring, right??? Service was great and friendly...food was ok. Love the fact that everyone got a reprieve from Thai food. Thanks, Chili's!

This could be the best Chilis on the island. It is amazing how friendly the servers are! I would even go as far as saying they are sparkly with enthusiasm!  So Boyfriend and I came here on Saturday night after a water logged camping excursion. We were literally just going to get salad (I love the ranch at Chilis), but our server made everything sound so yum! I ended up getting a watermelon margarita, the bf got a tall beer, and we split a triple dipper. Our choices were spinach&artichoke dip, and the two boneless chicken wing flavors. So good! We were too full for dessert but I will definitely be back for a molten cake!
OMG Burgers are great! Husband fell in love with there strawberry lemonade. Service was great! No wait which was great for a Friday we go their at around 4:30.

We had the sampler, it was mediocre. We also ordered the southern smokehouse burger, and that was amazing! The fries are also very good.   The service was wonderful. We never had to wait to be seated and our service was pleasant and happy.  I would give them give stars for service, but three for the food.

Based on all our past take-out orders, this place is absolutely horrible. Why? They NEVER seem to remember to give utensils with our meals. Do we have to ask each and every time? For future reference, apparently, you do.  I do have to note that the FIRST time I ordered take-out from them, they included everything including utensils, so because of this, I tipped them because I was so happy that they got everything right.  Since it's take-out, utensils aren't a priority b/c we brought the food home anyway. But most recently, I ordered take-out for my husband's birthday. Didn't expect much as I only ordered 3 meals and asked for a birthday dessert (an ice cream, which they did offer). Basically, we waited half an hour at home before leaving so that our food would be ready. When my husband got there, he had to wait another 30 minutes (a little over an hour TOTAL). When my husband got home, as I mentioned earlier, no utensils. No birthday ice cream (it was supposed to be a surprise for him so he had no idea that it was coming). And my daughter's $6.99 kids meal basically consisted of chicken strips and a chocolate milk. WTH? Where's the side? There was none. I paid $7 for a couple pieces of chicken and small cup of chocolate milk.  I feel like the more things I order (usually, we order 2 meals, but thought this time, my daughter deserved her own meal since it was a special occasion), the more things they mess up; and a nice, dinner at home turned into disappointment.  I like Chili's. But this location has been pissing me off the more and more I order from them. I didn't even bother to call them to complain because my husband said they were busy and the lady at the counter was nice..... I listened to him, but as a paying customer, just watch out and double check your order before you leave.

We were in the Mililani area with my sister & brother-in-law when we thought of having some drinks... Luckily, my "steak and potatoes" brother-in-law suggested this restaurant. After directing us here, we saw there was a crowd outside the door AND lo' and behold, it was Still Happy Hour! We were greeted with a smile and waited for about 5 minutes before we were promptly seated. I guess the crowd outside was a large group waiting for a party.  Service was quick as our beers were frosty in the mugs. We all ordered the Triple Dipper plate. Oddly, we all had the same selections; sliders, artichoke & spinach dip and honey-chipotle chicken. The sliders were done just right, still a bit juicy but cooked medium-well, the chips & dip were okay, and the chicken was a bit over-fried. Good points were the friendliness, quickness and accuracy of service. The beer was icy-cold and quenched our thirst. Food was a bit boring and mediocre. I had higher expectations for this family restaurant.

We come all the way from Honolulu (used to come from Kaneohe) just to eat at this location. My now husband (at the time we were engaged) went into anaphylactic shock twice in one night from eating dairy as he is allergic to it and made it known to our server. The manager (a nice guy of Asian decent) came by and helped us out that night. Since he was willing to help is, we decided to keep coming back to this particular Chili's. We have come back several times to this location as they fully understood my husband's allergy and catered to his needs. We were there this past Friday and our server then was bad, but Alika made it all better. We have had her before and is an EXCELLENT server and kept going back because of her. She smoothed things over on Friday night. We then take our good friends to Chili's today and had the worst experience ever and will never go back because of our NEGLIGENT server. DO NOT BE SEATED IN CHRIS'S section. He got upset as someone else started our drink and appetizer order as he was nowhere to be found for the first 20 minutes we were seated. It was almost empty today and service should have been better. It gets worse from here. We order our food about 25-30 minutes after being seated and we all knew what we wanted. My husband was the only one who got his food about 30 minutes after we ordered it. It still took another 20 minutes after his food to come out that we started questioning Chris and we also asked Alika and she was great, but our server did not care (we learned later he is a LIAR). He says he made a mistake with some if the food (he stated he needed to come clean and say he  put our food wrong in the computer). We accepted his apology and it wasn't until an hour and a half later 2 other people (in our party of 4) got their food. I ordered the boneless buffalo chicken salad and finally when my food came out, the chicken was cold. He had neglected bringing my food out when it was ready. I finally got my food again and decided I wanted it in a to go box as I wanted to leave. Alika had come back to the table to inform us that our whole bill is going to be free and taken care of by Chili's. About 20 minutes after that, my food I had boxed was finally brought back to me. Then Chris asked if we wanted anything else. Since it was on Chili's we got 3 molten cakes as a to go order. It took about 15 minutes and our server came back to say that the cakes were in the oven and almost out. He said he checked himself. Which that was a lie. If we were doing a to go order, they would pack it up and let us heat it up at home. We finally got our cakes and left. The server was laughing as we were leaving. Alika came up to us one last time to apologize over and over. We got to our car and looked at the molten cake to notice that it was not cooked and our server Chris has LIED once again to our faces. So if you want rotten, horrible service of an ex military man who is a liar and hates everyone, he is your man to see. It is sad that they lost loyal, good tipping customers due to one negligent worker who does not care about his job. The manager was nowhere to be found during this whole ordeal and I don't think he cared either.
Food is good, service is fast especially when you are at the bar area. We come here once in a while when we feel like cheating on our diet lol

Solid chain food. Went with friends, and Justin took good care of us. Friendly wait staff. Chips, salsa, a variety of entrees, and a couple of molten cakes, ran us about $165 for 6 adults.  I had the ribs.  They were okay. Our friends enjoyed the molten cakes, one chocolate, one peanut butter.

First off, I'm not a complainer, this is my first review because it needed to happen. Myself and the girlfriend stopped by to get a simple take out order ( one meal, soup and an appetizer) not only did we wait 40-45 minutes for our food but we had to go to the take out desk and ask what was going on with our order. The response we got was were putting it together. Which they told is about 10 minutes earlier as well. Before we could ask anything else the server answered the phone before assisting further.  It took a fellow employee to hold her hand and pull out our order from the heat rack. Which by the time we got our food everything was cold. Ergo how long was our food sitting there who knows. Also not only were we waiting for 20 minutes over the expected time,but they gave us the wrong soup in our order. I don't mind the no utensils went home to eat regardless. My advice, if you get take out, hound them about your order. Don't be afraid to ask it's their job. And also to check every last item they give you.

We just ate here (1/1/14) for our anniversary dinner. Our server (male) on the bar side was not very friendly or helpful. Our food took so long to get to our table when our appetizer arrived it was stuck together and barely eatible. We were asked once if everything was ok. Waters took too long to be refilled. We really wanted to eat dessert being it was our anniversary but the way things were going we just wanted to get out of there.  Not to mention the hostess didn't look like she wanted to be at work... The only workers that were smiling were the ones not helping us! Unreal...

Super slow service. Take out took 45mins from the time I ordered it till it was ready. Seem to be put on the back burner since it was to-go. Sucks not having a take-out pickup area too. At least Rubys has a pick up area..they even come out to your car there. If it wasn't for a gift card I would have steered clear. Oh well..Hope the food is up to par .

Not surprised by all of the low-star reviews at this place.  Here's mine.  Wife and I have been to this (and several other) Chili's  for the past 10+ years.  Our recent dinner was kind of a disaster.  Sat at our table and finally got our order in - not the server's fault she looked like the only server in the entire restaurant (5pm on a weekday).  We asked an assistant manager if we could have some chips and salsa and he said, "just so you know it's $X.99".  We were surprised by this because we've never once paid for chips and salsa.  he probably knew there was a reason for his 'warning' that they weren't free.. Right?  "Well for the 2 or 3 years I've worked here that's been the case".not delivered in a way that could be described as anything but rude.  We asked the table next to us how much they paid for chips and salsa, they didn't!  We still gave our server an awesome tip since she's new and this rude assistant manager has nothing to do with her service. It screwed up our experience and we're probably going to stick to one of the nice mex places on the n. shore which turn out to be fresher and cheaper.  Probably not going back to this Chili's.

Slowest service of any restaurant I have ever been to... Seriously. Went for lunch on a Thurs, with a total of about 15 people there. It took 15 min for our server to take our drink order, and 40 for our meals to come out. Forty minutes for a salad, bowl of soup, and two quesadillas, probably about the least complicated thing you could order. The food was good, but not even close to worth the wait. Don't waste your time here.

First, we had arrived with a party of three and was told we'd have to wait for about 15 minutes. A party of four came in after us, and was seated right away! When we asked what happened, we were told that they were trying to seat larger parties first--what happened to first come, first serve?  So when we were finally seated, the chips that they served us were all broke up pieces. When we asked our waitress for a new basket, she glared at us...seriously? We ordered our food, got it like 45 minutes later, and was maybe checked in on maybe twice. If we wanted something (refills, ready to order,  more chips), we pretty much had to whistle her over.  Lighting in there is really poor as well. There's a blinding light-bulb about 2 1/2 feet above your head, and it just hangs there. So you're pretty much eating with the light in your eyes the whole time.  Finally, the alcoholic drinks were NOT alcoholic drinks at all. We ordered a margarita, and it was sweetened so much, that you could have thought it was a virgin. But then we ordered a Coronanita (which btw, the waitress took to offense when I said it wrong), and that was probably the best thing that night. I wouldn't go back to this place, nor would I recommend it to anyone.

I like coming to this Chili's in Mililani. We have a great server named Alika.  She's the best!  She takes great care of us.  Also we're enjoying Chili's new Mexican menu. I had the choice of three from the Mexican entree menu. My dinner included a hard shell chicken taco, beef enchilada and a sour cream chicken enchilada with black beans and coastal rice.  It was all good.

Came here for dinner after movies. I don't know if it was because I was starving or if Chili's has improved but I really enjoyed my food this time. Food 4 stars: started with a endless chips and salsa. Chips are toasty warm when brought to you and the salsa is a decent tomato based, slightly better than your average jar salsa. Main course was a swiss and mushroom burger. It was huge and the flavor was pretty good. Friend had the 3 taco plate and it was pretty good as well. Service 4: our server was very attentive and came by several times to check on us and fill up drinks. Atmosphere: same as any other Chili's. Value 3: Things can get pricey fast but inline with other similar places.
We have always gotten great service here but my family and I don't care for the food so unfortunately we won't be back.

Our party shows up and they tell us its a 20min wait. As me and my friends are waiting to be seated everyone who was there before us got in! Clearly I'm thinking ok we are next. Another two parties show up while we have been sitting there so I get up to ask about a table and she says "oh we are trying to seat the larger parties first"......I was annoyed and of course not going back!

Update 12:19 p.m. I wrote my review of Chili's at Mililani this morning, and within a very short time, Kathy D. wrote to apologize for our bad experience and offered to make it right!  Now THAT'S true customer service!!! Not only did Kathy take ownership of the issues we faced yesterday, but worked with me to rectify them and make me and my party happy!  A BIG MAHALO TO KATHY!  You're amazing and a credit to Chili's! *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * ONLY 1-STAR RATING... What do you do on a rainy Sunday?  Either go shopping in a covered mall or find a restaurant and eat. . . We decided to have lunch at Chili's in Mililani.  Though I haven't been impressed with their food or service in the past (it's been over 5 years since we've dined here), we decide to give them a try once again. . .Big mistake! While they have a revamped menu and healthier dining choices to offer, it took over 1 hour to get our food from the time we ordered.  When we asked the hostess, who was cleaning the table next to us what the hold-up was, she asked if we wanted to speak with a manager, to which we said "yes!"  No manager ever came to our table.  When our food finally was delivered, the server told us that this is usually the case on Sundays: the kitchen is never staffed properly to cover the Sunday crowd.  WHY???  If management KNOWS that there will be a crowd on Sunday, especially a rainy Sunday when people can't be outdoors, you'd think experience would dictate proper coverage of the kitchen so that food orders could be served in a timely manner!  DUH?!!  The only redeeming factor was that the food was hot when it came out.  It took another 15 minutes for us to get mayo and extra tortillas for our fajita trio.  It seems as though customers who ordered appetizers get their food much quicker than those of us who ordered lunches. VERY POOR RESTAURANT MANAGEMENT, NO CUSTOMER SERVICE, NO RESPONSE TO OUR REQUEST TO SPEAK WITH A MANAGER.  Our server was pleasant and as helpful as she could be, notwithstanding the lack of food to serve, but she couldn't control the kitchen staff or light a fire under the kitchen staff to get our food out any faster than it was delivered... WON'T be dining here again any time soon.

So. Nothing crazy special. Child friendly. The staff seems half attentive, the price is high for the quality of food (in my opinion). The last three times I've been to this location my order was wrong (and no I don't have crazy requests lol)!  But, lost of parking, they ways fix their mistakes and again child friendly (That's a bid deal for me).

Yes! Another great night at Chili's! I actually haven't updated my original review since 2011 so this is a good time to do it.  Sat on the bar side at a "regular table" which may have been a good idea cause I'm not the most graceful on high stools.. Haha.  When I checked in via the Yelp app I got a special offer for free chips and queso! Yummy! I was planning to use my coupon from the email for my choice of appetizer so it was nice to use my check in offer! After a VERY brief scan of the menu I opted for the first thing that popped out at me, the avocado bacon chicken sandwich on a pretzel bun. The bun was toasted and crunch with juicy grilled chicken topped with lettuce, tomato, bacon and avocado. It was delish! I loved that the sandwich wasn't overly drippy. As a matter of fact, there was no drippage at all!  It came with fries...nice. As much as I wanted to, I could not finish the whole thing and brought home half of the sandwich and a few fries.  Our server, Josie, was very fast and checked up on us a couple times throughout the dinner. On a whim we added dessert at the last minute. We decided to get the molten chocolate peanut butter cup dessert... Not sure what the real name of ot is bit it was a marble molten cake (I think it included peanut butter?) with ice cream and topped with crushed chocolate peanut butter cup pieces. I'm not the biggest fan of this candy but this dessert was scrumptious!! See photo! So glad I came back to dine as it's been a while. Plus no liquor for me even though the tropical sunrise was tempting, I haven't had a drink in a really long time. Maybe on another occasion..we shall see.

Food and service is great.  Our family was seated in the bar area. Drunks at the bar were loud and using foul language within ear shot of other families. It's a bar but I prefer that they had seated us in the main room with preteen and teen daughters.  Too busy to be picky.   TIP:  Go early.
I don't normally eat at franchise restaurants like Chilis but they do make a very nice grilled chicken salad that is about $10.

After a writing a very bad review, I was contacted by the General Manager of this location. She was very kind and very helpful towards ensuring I had a good experience at Chili's. She sent me some gift certificates in which I plan to use at a later time. I must say she went above and beyond my expectations and definitely made up for the lack of service I had received in the past.

Last week I ate here and had gotten food poisoning. I had the triple dipper ....the mini burgers, chicken crispers, and boneless honey chipotle wings. I was throwing up all night after that and the next day. The waiters always forget to take off my free chips n queso when they give us our bill when we check In on yelp. Hate this place. I'd rather cook myself at home
Call ahead to reserve a table and when you arrive you won't wait so long on a Friday night!

Terrible. We entered as a couple with a sleeping baby. We were then escorted to be seated next to the bar. WoW! The baby subsequently awoke crying to loud drunk people and the ear scratging arousion of sports t.v. which was located not to mention directly aboue our table. Loaded potatoes sucked, the artichoke and spinach dip was not even enough for a chihuahua to eat and the over $6 soup was about the size of a childrens cereal bowl. Took 20 minutes to get our apetizers and restraunt was not full.

My family and I are regulars at Chili's. This past Sunday we decided once again to have dinner there. Like always the staff was pleasant and ordering our food was fast. However, We waited almost an hour for our food to come to our table. Within that hour our 3 kids were grumbling about when their food would arrive and my 2 year old was being beyond fussy. I kept asking the waitress what is the hold up and she couldn't give me an answer. The manager finally came to our table 45 minutes after we ordered and asked if we needed anything else and apologized for the long wait. When we finally got our food we weren't that hungry. Kids were full from eating the complimentary chips. I took only a few bites from my pasta then asked for a take out box. As I was putting the food into the box I was startled at what I found in my plate of noodles. I saw a very long white hair. I wanted to excuse myself to the bathroom to throw up. I told the waitress and showed her and she was mortified and embarrassed. She then called the manager out and the manager looked annoyed at the whole situation.  They did comp our 5 meals and gave us 7 gift certificates for our next visit, but I'm not too sure that we will return. This was just a horrible experience. Such a disappointment.

I like the food here.  I usually get the triple dipper or the chicken enchilada soup.  The soup is my favorite!!!  It's soooooo good!!!  My friends and I also like to come here to drink, it's a fun atmosphere to just kick back and relax. The other day I hurt my finger here.  The cushion on the chair wasn't secured on and my finger got caught between it and the top of my finger got sliced off.  It was very painful and disgusting. Our waitress and the manager were really helpful.  They gave me wipes and band-aides to clean my cut and were always coming back to check on us.  At the end of our meal, they comped our entire bill, well the food portion of it anyway.  I thought that was pretty decent of them. On a side note...if you check in on yelp or foursquare, they normally have a check in offer for free food.
Service sucked drinks were weak and over priced, but that's a chain for you .. Food was ok ... Manager was really nice though. Just average all together. Stick with beer or wine for drinks

I usually come during the slower late lunch time crowds... And my kids & I have an enjoyable meal!  Kinda disappointed on how the dinner crowds rolled tonight! Servers were under-staffed... Food took forever to get to the table... And our glasses were always empty!  I just wish they had more help tonight ... That would've made our party of 20 just a little bit more... Happy. Well... Atleast keep our glasses full!

Come here quite often because it is in our neighborhood and we enjoy the variety. My favorite is the chicken, bacon, avocado served on a pretzel bun.  Add a little ranch...yum!  The salads are good also.

Service here is sub-par! The seating area was 1/8 full on a afternoon.  He made us sit so he could find seats. .. I felt like it was a scene out of Meet The Parents. Service for water and the simple things takes double the time it should. Every experience here is the same!  Why do I keep coming back?

IT'S ALWAYS SOMETHING with this location...My wife and I like Chili's food, but every time we visit the Mililani location, something happens to make the experience less enjoyable. Once it took over a half hour to get seated even though there were empty tables everywhere.  Another time my wife asked specifically if the fried onion topping would be crispy, was assured it would be, and it came out soggy. The last time we went (and I do mean the LAST time) there wee dirty tables all around us, workers walking all around, but nobody was cleaning. The owner needs to invest in quality managers. There's no excuse for this place not being able to offer an enjoyable experience when others around the state and country do. Next time I feel like having Chili's, I'll drive to Waikele or Pearl Ridge.

The service sucked tonight. I've been here before many times, great service, ok food, ok price, but tonight they seemed short handed or something. The chips and salsa came fast, same with drinks, meals took a little longer but 2 of our orders were wrong. The dessert took about 25 minutes from the time we ordered them to come out.  What really annoyed me was that the server and busers did not clear our table at all. They kept squeezing plates on. There were still appetizer plates on the table when they brought out the desserts and they still didn't clear the table.  Not impressed Chili's, hope you can hire more people soon.

Their service is terrible. I've given them multiple chances thinking maybe it was just that server having a bad day, but it's always bad. Most recently I got food poisoning from a chicken salad and ended up at urgent care getting meds and IV fluids. I won't be returning.

I came here with my hubby on a friday during lunch hour. Service was friendly and fast. They did forget our soups though but they quickly brought that out once we reminded them. The whole parking lot layout is weird so it might be difficult at times to find parking.

Great food for late nights on a Friday night was looking for a place to eat we went here also excepts id card the isle discount card love the 5.00 off 25.00 or more purchase and our waitress  Theresa was a great help and always there for us would go again she was great love the food.

Best Chili's experience!  Theresa was such an awesome server. I'm giving them 5 stars mostly because of the service she provided us!  She was super friendly from the time we sat down and looks like she really enjoys her job!  The chipotle steak bowl was pretty good too! The steak was soft and tasty. I would order the bowl again! Not bad for about $14.

Chili's - Mililani I was unsure to go back but decided to give Chili's another try. It's Sunday and we decided to grab a late dinner.  We Walked in... without a Friendly Greeting ( I guess we don't fit in)  This was my thought after we sat down. Seats were dirty with grains of Rice. Menu was dirty & noticeable. Yuck!  Hand wipes are a must!! Can't believe that after 8:30pm they just don't care. Total Turn off - Hostess is continually picking food off of other Hostess Plate(who's on her break). So Gross. She was sitting in the next booth/table to my right. She also kept touching her hair. She stuffed her mouth with french fries and greeted customers as they walked. Ghetto. Our Waitress did a good job taking our order, she kept coming by to check on us and gave my husband a refill without asking. Drop the bill off and then she disappeared.  Money Wasted and Went home with a disappointed feeling.  So Long Chili's!

I know what you get with going to a chain restaurant so I typically am not too picky. However I don't like waiting ten minutes for a waitress to walk up and say "you know what you want to drink?" Why yes I do and my food order as well so as I start saying my order she walks off. Being that we ordered alcohol she takes a crap ton of time to come back. We are 25 minutes in before she even comes and take our orders  This woman was so unbearable I couldn't even look at her. When she was interacting with a table behind us someone told her the food was bad and she literally said "well what do you expect me to do about it?" She was not being sarcastic and the people were furious. My food was okay, chain restaurant quality, normal. But I was feeling like desert and hated this broad even more when she brought me the check without asking if we wanted anything else. We had half our food on our plates and weren't offered boxes either. But hey it is all good because I bet a two dollar tip made her as angry as I was. I'm not a low tipper by any means, but if you can't do your job you don't deserve much, as a server who never took it out on my customers I can not understand her motive. Chiles needs to reevaluate their servers because she made sure I will never come back.

Went here last week for my daughter's birthday.  Food was okay but they charged for appetizers that were supposed to be free due to a coupon. Only saw our waiter a couple of times and when we did he wouldn't ask if everything was okay. He would simply look to see if our plates were empty and moved on.

Came to chilis tonight for Monday night football. We decided to stir at the bar... Best service I have ever had at this location!! The bartender, Nate, was quick and professional at all times even with a crowded bar. Will definitely be back during football season!
The bar tender nate is the hottest bartender ever. Excellent service and food was perfect

My stomach got upset immediately when they asked me to donate to their Cause against cancer as soon as I sat down. I wanted a pleasant lunch...I'd leave but I'm hungry. The manager was nice to offer to comp the meal, but it just looses the relax value of eating out.
Got right in took 20 mins . To get are drinks and order. another 20 for are chips and salsa. service was horrible along with the food extremely disappointed in this chili's

Waited for my food for 30 minutes when it wasn't that busy and it wasn't the greatest. The waiter kept on serving the table in front and behind us paying no attention to our table. Didn't get our water refilled until we got our check. So honestly, not that great of an experience.

I do not recommend going to Chillis in mililani because their food is horrible and the service is even worse! The last time that I went my enchiladas were super cold like it was in the refrigerator and not cooked in the stove. I told my server and he looked at me like I was crazy.  I asked for the manager, she looked confused on what she should do. So mind you I left there still being hungry. I will not be returing!
my first experience was horrible, my second third and fourth, freaking awesome.  I come at least one a week now.
The food was good. Service wasn't over the top or anything.   I'll be sure to unlock the check in offer next time!

Just made a takeout order tonight(10/30) at around 9 and got there to pick it up at around 9:30. We were told by the host to go to the takeout counter, which then told us to see the bartender. We patiently waited for her to notice us(about 5-10 minutes, not too long) and when she did we told her ordered a takeout. We feel like she rolled her eyes at us, but we don't know. Anyway, we brushed that off and waited for our food. Waitress with white cross earrings brings out our food and asks us if we want utensils, then she gave us attitude about having to get them. She came back, dropped it in our bag, and left.  Overall..bartender lady and waitress need an attitude check. If we ever see them at the restaurant again, I'll make sure we don't have them serving us.

We went on Veterans Day because they were providing a meal to those who serve. There was quite a wait, and although there were some empty tables around, I respected that they didn't overwhelm the cooks and the waiters by over filling the place.  We were told a 30-40 min wait, we were seated in 20 at a nice booth. Our Waitress took time to reach us, but she was attentive the whole time. My drink was never empty, and our orders came quickly. Her attitude was wonderful and the food were yummy. I'm all about customer service so I gave it 5 stars, the food 4 stars.

The service is mediocre. 1st incident a couple of days ago, placed an order hours ahead and called an hour before just to make sure my order would be ready when I come in to the "pickup window". My order was late over 20 minutes past my time but I received a 50% discount, okay cool but, here I am again same predicament, I placed the order 4 hours ahead and I am waiting 20 minutes again! Time is money, and this is a joke, you place an order to pick up at a certain time HOURS ahead, it better be ready at that time you tell them. Trash service for calling ahead. Oh yea, I am still waiting! I'll update, well they are just NOW making it but they said they aren't charging me for it. It improves the situation slightly but still one star. You decide my people.
It is an average place to eat at. Service is a little slow. It becomes really busy on weekends. It is a nice change when you get tired of eating on base.

The food is really good.  I mean, probably the best tasting food at any Chili's on the island.  So, why the 3 stars?   1.  For starters its not a "cozy" Chili's...it's the "BRIGHTEST" Chili's I've ever been in.  And I have been in Chili's all over the mainland and the world.  Quite honestly the lighting gives me a headache.  I can start to feel sick from the lighting before the food ever comes.  I get the same sensation every time we go, so I figure its time to mention. 2.  Plus, we always order the bottomless chips & salsa...they always rock.  This is the ONLY Chili's we have ever gone to where they charge you to take home a bag of chips & salsa.  So, the minute you ask to take home a bag it doesn't matter if they have only brought you one bowl or 10...they become bottomless and will cost MORE if you want to take some home. We love Chili's anywhere, but heed to warning on the two above items when you go.

This is a late review but much deserved 5 starts for excellent service. We come here pretty often because my sister is picky about her food and chicken crispers have always been her favorite food. For years! There's not many places to eat in Mililani, and Chili's isn't a high end place or anything, but the food is always pretty good. The menu is a lot more extensive nowadays! I still try to stick to what I know, but I think I tried one of their newer burgers this time around, and I wasn't disappointed.  I can't think of a time we have bad service. Plus, this is Mililani so occasionally I run into a few of my old classmates who are working and they are always awesome. Always great people helping us out.  Anyway, I love that there is a yelp check in offer for the free queso and chips. The chips and salsa are BOTTOMLESS. Not sure if the deal is still available...BUT that was definitely a good deal for my family because we were already so hungry when we got there.  Our server's name was Chelsea Kido, and she was so friendly! Great service from beginning to end. Always on top of things, asking if we needed anything, filling up our waters, etc. Always with a smile. She even let us take a big bag of chips home, you know, those bottomless chips. We filled the bag with out leftovers and she came back and brought us some more before packed it all up.  The best thing was that she honored both discounts/deals that I presented. I used the yelp check in and still tried to use my iDcard for the additional discount off the food. She mentioned that only 1 deal is accepted per visit, but she ran it by her boss and they accepted my iDcard discount as well. How sweet!  Thanks for the awesome service, Chelsea!
CHILIS is always a good experience.  We ordered the chips and queso with our yelp coupon.  We also had the bacon ranch quesadilla and the California flat bread pizza.   All items were yummy!

Boyfriend and I were seated immediately, which was a shocker for us because other Chilis we've been to always had some type of wait. Anywho, if you check in you get the free chips and dip. They have these tablets on the table, with games, menu and to even pay the bill. Cool beans. The food here is way better then the other Chilis locations, like they actually take time and effort to cook.  Any way. The reason for only 3 stars isn't beciaee of our waitress. It was for the ones next to us. I felt really bad, they've been waiting for water the entire time we ate there and the woman asked twice. She had to wave her hand to fix her check and everything- and the worker never came back.  It wasn't even busy!  Anywho, that is all.

I love going to mililani chilis. they have great service and especially the food. I took my family there to eat and they also loved it. and now it's like every weekend we're there to enjoy there tasty and delicious food. I told friends and family about my experience at chilis. More life really happens here at chilis.
Chilis in Mililani is awesome! Service is great, food is always hot and delicious! Luckily for us it's not too far! I would definitely recommend them to any of my friends!

I came here last night with my mom, cousin and two nieces (4 & 2). First when we were sat the waitress confused us by only half talking to us because someone was talking in her earpiece. How do I still give a 5 star? read on... We ordered a rack of ribs with broccoli and corn, chicken tacos, fajitas, and a triple dipper, along with a glass of wine, and a presidente margarita.   After about 15 minutes a staff member (Nate) came out and apologized because they were out of broccoli(my 4yo nieces order), no biggie she ordered fries instead. After about another 15 min, all of food came out, except the waitress notices after she had put the platter in front of my mom that the wings were bone in  and mom had ordered boneless. She took the entire platter back into the kitchen, leaving my mom with nothing to eat for another 10 minutes or so.  Keep in mind we did not complain once to anyone but a gentleman named Nate came out again and said he is apologizing for the kitchen and staff and is comp'ing our food. This has NEVER happened where they comp'ed all of our meals before, we were shocked, since like I said we never even complained once because really we were having fun with our nieces and shrugged off all the time/waitress mishap. We ended up only paying for the drinks and I think maybe our dessert.   I'm honestly shocked by the amazing customer service that Nate gave to us and another table next to us. He is someone that saw what was going on with none of us complaining but knew it was wrong and took it upon himself to fix it. BRAVO NATE! BRAVO! AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!
None of the food here tastes like it is fresh. All the vegetables in everything they serve here don't taste fresh.

We come here every so often. The servers are very friendly and are efficient most of the time. On this visit, we had:  1) garlic fried pickles w/ ranch, tasted good but you can only have so much of it. Huge pieces of garlic inside batter.  2) ribeye steak (med rare) w/ mashed potatoes - very fatty meat. The mash was good in the skillet.  3) buffalo chicken salad- huge, the chicken was good. Just too much going on, something tasted off, couldn't pin point it.  I liked being able to pay via the ziosk on the table!  Overall, great service, food meh; )
Wendy our waiter was super nice and really went the extra mile. Especially when I thought i left my phone there she went and searched for it. The quesadilla salad explosion was a winner

I came in here to eat last night with my hysband and 2 kids. It was busy when we got there but were sat immediately. Our server Jeny greeted us right away, got our drinks out to us immediately. She took my kids order first and helped us with purchasing the games on the new computers for my son to play.(Only $1.99 for unlimited play), and for those of us that have a 5 year old, it is a great tool to have. The kids got their food first and ours soon followed. The tripples are delicious! I noticed that there was one manager on last night, I believe her name was kellie. I was impressed with how she got down to the tables level and how she handled some of the tables. These are just some things I noticed last night! I felt very comfortable there because I knew that there was so much teamwork going on between all of the employees, I knew that if I needed anything someone was close by to help. We will definitely be back soon!
Food was good, but service was slow. We came at a time when there weren't many customers yet, so we didn't understand why they were slow.

Chili's is one of those places where you know what to expect as far as food quality.  The food for the most part is pretty consistent.   They do change their menus often,  which is an added bonus because it allows the customers to try different dishes.  If you want to stay on the safe side,  the triple dipper is always a winner.  Pick any three items from the selection  and BAM you have a variety of things to choose from while eating.  The chocolate molten cake is to die for,  along with the chocolate chip cookies with ice cream. Ask for an extra scoop - -  you can never go wrong with EXTRA ice cream.  Also,  they've added a new technological feature to their "dine in"  experience, an ipad like device that allows you to browse through their menu,  order items,  and even play games! Stay away during Military pay day,  the place is just way too crowded and during the rush,  the customer service is often hit or miss!

The value here is hit and miss. The service is usually pretty good but there are a few servers with bad attitudes. I am usually happy when I order a burger or chicken sandwich but the fajitas are just pathetic. I had the "choose two" fajitas tonight and LITERALLY got about $3 worth of meat...and the dish costs $17! Steer clear of the steak and fajitas if you care anything about value but go for a good beer and a burger.

Smaller portions and high prices fall short of expectations. I remember ordering chilis fajitas over the years when I had a big appetite and needed to put down a monster meal. I have always enjoyed the fajitas as it was historically enough for two people or just me, haha. The last few times I've been there I have noticed that the amount of meat is roughly half of what it once was. The sides changed too. You used to get a plate with a generous scoop of guacamole and sour cream, a pile of lettuce, followed by cheese and pico de gallo. Now they have gone to a visually impressive tower with tiny cups of the garnishes. It's visually impressive, I admit. Having said that, I am far more interested in quantity than I am in their deceptive little children's size cup of cheese and guacamole for my fajitas. The price hasn't gone down but the portion size sure has. Shame on them. It's one of their signature dishes after all.

This place is always hit or miss, sometimes we go and it's good but most times when we go they are just not that great. The last visit we were there for two hours because they were short staffed. My husband's steak was way overcooked and it just wasn't worth waiting another hour for a different one. The waitress took the steak off our bill thankfully but everything else was just very bland, overcooked and not worth the extra charge. Not everyone wants steamed broccoli and fried potatoes so it's slightly annoying when you get charged for having to change your sides. The waitresses are very nice though so there is at least that. The kitchen needs to get it's act together and go back to the old menu where you can choose what you want with your meal.

Service was so slow tonight!  We waited an hour for our food.  It wasn't busy and there was no manager walking around as usual to ask guests if everything was okay. This is one of my worst experiences here.
fast seating.  waiter did take some time in bringing our drinks so we did have to ask another waitress.  our chips were low and they didn't offer to refill it.  Green sauce fajitas was awesome!!

Its a good place to hang out, and have a nice meal fast. The service has been top notch, and the food comes out quickly. The atmosphere is what you would expect and popular chain to be. I always pick new things to try, and they always seem to update there menu. For the money, its a hell of a deal.

As soon as me and my date walks in. We are welcome with a warm greeting and yes the waiting was quite long but it was worth wait. When we was seated to our table. The kind server took our order and when our food came to our table. The food we ordered was correct and nothing was wrong about it. While we ate at this fancy place our water level of our water cups was running low. But as soon as one us was 1/4 done with our water. The kind server would refill our glass of water. Anyways as far as the food that was given. It was hot. The desert was really satisfying as much as it looked on the menu. We enjoyed every last bit of the main dish and the desert that we ordered. The costumer service really reached my expectation and we are willing to come back. The food is very satisfying
Not bad. Busy lounge yet food came out good and service was good. Nothing amazing or great but enjoyable

I had to make a run to Walmart while staying on the island with my family and, hungry after dropping some money, we found Chili's in a plaza right next door. This was a pretty busy area, lots of parking, but lots of filled spaces. Of course I figured the restaurants would be busy too, but we only had a 10-15 minute wait. They told us a table had freed up, and didn't want us to wait too long, so the hostess asked if putting a chair at the end of the table would be okay to accommodate five of us. It's not my ideal setup, but I am a hostess too and feel bad when asking if a chair is okay, so it didn't bother us at all. Our server, Kevin, was phenomenal. He noticed our sunburned faces and suggested aloe with lidocaine (oh boy did it help!) and then suggested other places we had to check out on the island from hiking trails to snorkeling coves. I don't know when, or if, we will return to Oahu, as this was a pretty big family trip, but I do recommend. It's your standard Chili's filled with nice people.

Tried some new menu items tonight. The new spinach queso was definitely a winner. Still bummed they don't have the potato skins or spinach and artichoke dip anymore. They've been pretty good lately about giving chips and salsa when the food is going to take a while.

Its chilli's, just more pricey because its hawaii. Nothing special about this place. They added a new taco menu, which was mediocre. I didn't care for it at all, I'll just stick to the shrimp tacos and call it a day.

This is late but, I believe is worth the review. About 2 months ago, my daughter and I visited Chili's in Mililani for lunch and as we were so graciously taken care of by our waitress I notice in a booth diagonally across from us two managers PRAYING over their food. This blew me away, they held hands and prayed over their meal, now, my family and I pray over our food regularly at home and in public. But rarely these days do you see people pray over their food or for that matter praying in public. I felt moved to go and greet these two lovely women and let them know I am so thankful to know that the managers of a restaurant I am eating in believe enough to pray and to pray in public view. :)  Our food was delicious this day and the customer service was excellent.

The food was great and our waiter was great, however when we walked in there was no hostess to be found. We were about to seat ourselves then one of the waiters apologized and grabbed her for us. I advised the hostess that we had 5 and although the dining area was pretty much empty she brought us to a 4 seat table and stated she would grab us another chair. We ended up moving to bigger table per one of the waitresses. Not sure why she didn't just seat us at one of the bigger tables in the first place.

We tried Chilis happy hour for the first time. Staff is great.  Kevin was very attentive. The food 2as ok.  The trio fajitas didn't look as good as the picture in the menu and was a lot smaller than expected.  The buffalo wings were kinda small too.  The berry margaritas are huge and there's lots of tequila in it so beware.  They taste great but hit you hard 10 min later.

I'm generally not a huge fan of chain restaurants, but sometimes you want something that is familiar and with my parents and son visiting from the mainland, familiar was just what they needed after a day trip to the North Shore. I would have preferred a loco moco, but visitors demand sacrifice. The service was good, not great.  However, compared to Ruby Tuesdays (a comparable chain restaurant), the service as fantastic (the service at Ruby Tuesdays is HORRIBLE).  The food was better than I've remembered in the past, but super overpriced.  All in all, it's worth another visit the next time the family is in town.

Seated right away. But the waiter did NOT want to be there...at all... which brought down the mood because it was as though we were bothering him to order... i got the sliders and was not really happy with the quality, pretty bland. Small portion of fries too. Margarita was suuuuuper tart. Tasted like straight up sour mix.
The plates donot look like they are suppose to..front house is not organized bad service in the entrance.. the only reason im giving it stars is because the waitress was very nice and tentive.

Me and my boyfriend ordered take out for two triple dippers and an order of onion rings. I know it was my fault I didn't double check and once we were almost home they didn't give us our onion rings. So we called them back and the worker that answered the phone said they were going to mail us a gift card to replace it. It's been a week already and received nothing from them.
This is the 3rd time here. Service is pretty good. Not too long of a wait to be seated. Food is good. Spare of the moment spot for lunch with my hubby
Decided  to give chili's another try tonight and I must say it was excellent the service was fast and they were very nice and the food was as I expected amazing!!!

The food was delicious but I got food poisoning from the quesadilla explosion salad.  Had it yesterday and I've been suffering since 6:30 last night.  Didn't eat anything else yesterday so I'm sure it was the salad.  The rest of my family is fine, and enjoyed different meals.

OK doing an update from my previous review... Doing a little better. Today was my sons graduation so we decided to go to chili's.  We arrived a little after lunch so we missed the lunch rush. We were quickly seated and placed our order. She brought us some salsa and chips but it took forever. It also took a long time for our food to come out and it wasn't even busy. Our server was really friendly and apologetic about my sons meal being delivered to another table but it was a little late. Everyone was done eating. The server offered to comp our meal then the manager offered to get him a dessert... We thought both was going to be comped. Then one of our dishes was loaded with salt (chicken enchilada, green Chile chicken enchilada, and beef enchilada plate) the server said the meat was already premixed so if they made another batch it would be the same. We were bummed because it looked so good. We will definitely have to try again.
Our server was excellent. The food was just ok.

I love Chilis food. However.. I will make the drive to Waikele Chilis because it has 1) better service and 2) the food somehow tastes better. I am an young adult, I do look somewhat younger than my age, but I am a PAYING CUSTOMER. I don't know why waiters over here treat me like I'm a child. They don't ever check up on my table when I'm dining with my other young adult friends who are respectful. We all work in the food industry so we know how to treat other fellow workers. Every. Single. Time. We came to eat at this Chilis- (6+ times) there has not been ONE nice waiter or hostess. They will forget about us after they drop off the food.. Thank God that they have those little setups where you can order dessert and pay at your table or I don't know how long we would sit around waiting! Stick to waikele or kapolei Chilis. They have nicer staff who know how to act like they like their jobs!
Love the chips and queso!  Flat bread pizzas are yummers, the Texas cheese fries are the BOMB!

Arrived a little after 6 for dinner with the family. We were told the wait was 15-20 minutes but we were seated within 10. Jenny was awesome. Very attentive even though she had soooo many others to take care of. She worked very hard and she was lso nice that my son even wanted to personally give her a tip rather than leaving it on the table. She is definitely an asset to this location...don't ever let her leave!!!!!  Oh, and by the way, the food was great. Hands down the best Chilis we've been to!

07/01/15 Came in for dinner around 9pm on a Wednesday night. Our server's name was Michelle and she was by far the GREATEST, most friendly and welcoming waitress that I've ever encountered at any Chili's location!!!! She was attentive and ON POINT! Best experience at chili'S thus far. :-)

Went to have a lunch at chili's with my Co workers. Just wanted to say lunch was great!  Everything came out perfect, had our appetizers first followed by our lunch,  hats off to the cooks! Our waitress, Michelle,  was AWESOME she took excellent  care of us and always wore  a big smile the whole time ,she even surprised our Co workers with a birthday dessert Thanks chili's !                                        -Don

Not thrilled with this restaurant at all. But I didn't really like it on the mainland either. Just shocked at the prices. Same amount of food but charging close to three times as much. Not going back.

I love this chilis. We come a lot lol. The bottomless soup and salad is my favorite and the kids get mac and cheese and split it. The Waitresses usually know what I want before I ask. Makes our visit easy

We have always had great service, thats the only reason it got 2 stars instead of 1. We've tried it multiple times and are disappointed with our food each time. Its usually soggy and not warm. Drinks are hit or miss I guess it just depends on who's bartending.
This is our "go to" place. We eat here at least twice a month. With great service and food you can't go wrong. They do get packed on the weekends so it's best to call ahead and make a reservation.

Had Theresa again this evening and she is always so positive and happy to be at work. We always have a pleasant experience when we have her as our waitress. She's fast, efficient, and I'm glad we had her again tonight!

I've been going here for a long time and sometimes it's a hit or miss. I'm really digging the new ziosk tablet they have. My bf and I get to play Life while we eat, and sometimes we're in a hurry to catch a movie so we're able to pay right away via the ziosk. Fast and easy. But our last visit had an issue, we changed an item and it took our waitress a while to fix it on the tab, she didn't really check on us so we had to flag her down. I feel bad for changing the item, but I feel she should have changed it on the tab right away. If we hadn't checked, we would have paid more than we should have.

Parking lot was big, but navigation through it can be a bit confusing.  Was greeted right away. Darius was really attentive to our table. The service was great, the atmosphere was chill, and over all it was a great experience.

I was just telling HC how I would come to this Chili's all the time when I was in college.  Now that we live close by, we come to eat here quite often.  One thing I really like about this Chili's is the quality of service.  Every server we've had here has been excellent. During our most recent visit, we had a guy named Dan (I think that was his name).  He was super personable and came by just enough to see how we were doing. He also scored another point in my book for having a cute Pokemon belt!   As far as food and drinks go, I enjoy their seasonal lemonades and will usually get one when we stop in. We also usually like to get a triple dipper to share (HC loved the onion rings this time around).  We also tried the new grilled chicken burrito.  It was something I would order again.  It seems that no matter when we go, the entire restaurant is packed. Families, couples, and groups of friends are all over the place sharing a bowl of bottomless chips and salsa.  Definitely stop by for good food and service.

Blah. I come here sometimes on my way home from work and I've had mixed experiences. One time some coworkers and I went and just had the table side guacamole. It took forever just for the the waitress to lug the cart out. We kept asking and she finally came out and made it. I must say it was absolutely delicious! But then another time stopped here after work and asked for the table side guac, and they said they didn't have ripened avocados, only the pre-made guac which was disgusting. The enchiladas I ordered were the worst I ever had!!! Absolutely gross. The chicken they use in enchiladas, flat bread, quesadillas, etc is not fresh at all. It's those fake chicken pieces that have a rubbery texture. Also service is always bad. Every single time I've had an issue with being seated. I prefer the one by my house in pearl ridge!

I like to eat here more often than I should. :) I'm not super experimental with my food, I usually get the Triple Dipper with the spring rolls, buffalo boneless wings and the little fried cheese things. lol Love the pineapple-blueberry margaritas! Love the e-mail coupons as well! Always friendly service, and decent prices.

So disappointed. You would think i went on a weekend night with how busy they were acting.  My family waited at the table for over 15 minutes just to br briefly greeted abd told they were really busy. Umm ok.... i get it. Ive been a server but 15 minutes to greet?! At least have another not so busy server bring waters over.  There was a free queso for uding the Yelp check-in which was way cool.  The food was average. Nothing special and exciting.
